choices.D: Conditions configured in the Access Control must evaluate to true.
choices.B: Scripts configured in the Access Control must evaluate to true.
choices.E: The user must be granted access through a business rule.
choices.C: Other matching Access Controls for the records evaluate to true.
choices.A: The user has one of the roles specified in the Required roles related list.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are the correct options

I believe that the correct answer should be A, B, C and D

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-platform-security/page/administer/contextual-security/concept/access-control-rules.html

Search for "ACL evaluation process" on the page and you can find the following line as well:
"[Record ACL rules only] The matching table-level and field-level ACL rules must both evaluate to true."

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are the correct options
A :The user has one of the roles specified in the Required roles related list. true

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements must evaluate to true for a user to pass an Access Control? (Choose three.)

choices.D: It is a checked out workflow which is being edited
choices.B: It is generated from a workflow version, executes activities, and follows transitions
choices.A: The table for which a workflow is defined plus any conditions such as "Active is true"
choices.C: The business reason or process for which a workflow is designed

choices.B: An Application Properties page is a good landing page for an application
choices.D: Application users know to go to the Application Properties page to change the appearance of an application
choices.A: Application Properties allow a developer to override the application properties inherited from ServiceNow
choices.C: Application Properties allow a developer or admin to make changes to an application's behavior without modifying application artifacts

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is a benefit of creating an Application Properties page for each application you develop?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is the best option

choices.B: The application needs to run a clean up script on the last day of every month
choices.C: The application needs to query the database every day to look for unassigned records
choices.D: The application needs to run a client-side script at the same time every day
choices.A: The application needs to send weekly email reminders to requestors for all records on a table

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is NOT an example of when an application might use a Scheduled Script Execution (Scheduled Job)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
All the others are server side which is good for scheduled jobs. client side isn't ideal for schedule jobs.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Scheduled Jobs run on the server side, you cannot run a client script daily, D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Scheduled scripts are server side scripts, thus running a client-side script at the same time everyday cannot be accomplished with a scheduled script execution.
The application needs to run a client-side script at the same time every day

Selected Answer: A
No you can not access the "previous" object in script action.
